text_section1.text: He could make you laugh! Cry! Love! Hate! He could make you a hero or a coward -- at a flick of the dials on his fantastic machine...
The Emotion Maker
Coward! Hisss! Manuel is ze coward!

text_section2.text: Coward!

text_section4.text: Du Bois -- stop it! You've turned the bravest matador of all Spain into a cringing coward!

text_section1.text: How I regret that first day I met David Du Bois atop the Eiffel Tower in France...

text_section2.text: Ah, my American friend. One day all Paris shall lay at my feet! My power shall be felt in all the great cities of the world!

text_section3.text: Really! I assume you control some giant financial empire, Mr. Du Bois?

text_section1.text: No -- not yet M'sieur Travers! But one day soon! Come -- you must visit with me in my studio! We shall be close friends!

text_section2.text: Quite an interesting character! Looks like my trip to Paris is going to provide a few laughs!

text_section1.text: At Du Bois's bizarre studio I could hardly suppress a smile...

text_section2.text: It is here that my secret rests, Travers! Soon, I shall unchain my scientific giant for all the world to see!

text_section3.text: A real crackpot! He's probably trying to make gold or something!

text_section1.text: For a month we were constant companions! Then, early one evening he appeared at my hotel wide eyed with excitment...

text_section2.text: Some, Travers! We are going to the theatre to see the greatest actor in all France - Jean Farge!

text_section3.text: Oh, yes -- he's winning rave notices playing the part of a coward at the Boulevard Theatre! Okay, let's go!

text_section1.text: Shortly, in a theatre box...

text_section2.text: Du Bois! What in the thunder is that thing? Why are you pointing it at the stage?

text_section3.text: Do not fear, my friend! My machine will not harm Jean Farage -- it will merely steal a bit of his skill!

text_section1.text: As I nervously watched Du Bois operate the strange device...

text_section2.text: No... No! I beg of you -- do not harm me!

text_section3.text: Ah, yes! Farge is indeed the master actor -- he plays the perfect coward!

text_section1.text: Afterward, my incredible friend launched still another surprise when we returned to his studio...

text_section2.text: Great thunder Bu Dois! Cut out the mystery and tell me what this mumbo jumbo is all about!

text_section3.text: In time -- in time, M'sieur Travers! We have seen the greatest actor in Paris -- now we must visit the bravest bull fighter! Tonight we leave for Spain!

text_section1.text: I was too fascinated to resist! Morning found us in the dressing room of the famous Matador, Maniel...

text_section2.text: Manuel, the fairest lady in Paris requests the bravest matador in Spain to wear her rose in the ring today!

text_section3.text: W-Why, that's the rose he had in his studio! What could he be giving it to Manuel for?

text_section1.text: Shortly, the crowd cheered as Manuel met the first bull...

text_section2.text: Ah! He wears the rose!

text_section3.text: Du Bois' losing his wits! I better drop him as a friend before he does something dangerous!

text_section1.text: Suddenly, as the bull turned to charge...

text_section2.text: Manuel! What ees wrong with heem?

text_section1.text: No... no!
Help me! Don't let ze bull harm me!
The arena went wild! The incredible had happened! -- Spain's famed matador was a... coward!

text_section2.text: That rose! Somehow it made Manuel a coward! How... how did you do it?

text_section3.text: Aha! I stole the cowardly emotion of Jean Farge and gave it to Manuel! For all science someone must suffer, my friend!

text_section1.text: Anger, disgust, fear welled up inside me as Du Bois gleefully explained his secret...

text_section2.text: You see, my friend, like sun draws water from the clouds I can draw emotions from people! Manuel breathed not only the aroma of a rose -- but the scent of a coward also!

text_section1.text: Du Bois! You're breaking the laws of nature! I'll have nothing more to do with you or your terrible experiment!

text_section2.text: Very well, Travers! But you are a fool! I now have power over every man on Earth! I'll sell emotions as the baker sells different breads!

text_section1.text: In the days to follow I couldn't shut Du Bois or his terrible device from my mind! Evidences of his work were everywhere...

text_section2.text: W-why, it's Papa Beauchamp! He's jumped from the tower!

text_section3.text: An old man -- with the courage of a paratrooper! Could this be some of Du Bois work?

text_section1.text: Hate struck in a museum...

text_section2.text: I hate this museum -- I hate it!

text_section3.text: T-the museum curator! Great grief! He's the most mild-mannered man alive -- what happened to him?

text_section1.text: Greed seized the president of a bank...

text_section2.text: It's mine -- do you understand? All the banks money belongs to me alone!

text_section3.text: Sacre bleu! Our president has lost hees senses!

text_section1.text: Uncontrollable sadness swept a gala Paris ball...
Finally, the moment came when I could stand no more...

text_section2.text: He's testing his terrible power everywhere! It's just a matter of time before someone is killed or injured!

text_section1.text: I'm the only person who knows his secret! And it's up to me to stop him! I can't have him arrested -- nobody would believe me! Yes... but perhaps there is one way to stop his devilish work!
That night, I waited until the lights of Du Bois' laboratory blinked out and...

text_section2.text: He must have the vial I want among his emotion bottles...

text_section1.text: Cautiously, I played my flashlight beam along the row of bottles until...

text_section2.text: Yes... yes... this is the one!

text_section1.text: Remembering each move Du Bois made, I duplicated them to the letter...

text_section2.text: I mustn't make the smallest mistake -- this is the one chance to save us all from Du Bois' fearsome device!

text_section1.text: The, I reversed his emotion device as I had seen him do...

text_section2.text: It must work... it must!

text_section1.text: Long minutes later, Du Bois awoke! Had I succeeded...?

text_section2.text: Such a pleasant rest! I-I feel so relaxed -- at peace with the world!

text_section1.text: For a long moment he studied his lab equipment! Then...

text_section2.text: What a beast I've been to threaten human nature! Tinkering with emotions is an insult to humanity! I'll destroy my work forever!

text_section1.text: I'm happy... at long last I'm really happy!

text_section2.text: Yes, Du Bois, you're happy through no fault of your own! You really developed this emotion because of the hate that festered within you!

text_section1.text: ... But now it's saved you from yourself!
